Cara Lewis in Idaho | occupation = | known_for = | height = | weight = | predecessor = | successor = | religion = | criminal_charge = first-degree theft (defrauding the state Department of Social and Health Sciences of $3,620.27 that was paid for her foster care),
second-degree theft (defrauding [[Clark College (Washington)]], $1,050 in tuition was waived after she claimed to be a homeless teen),
perjury (illegally obtained a Washington State identity card under the false name Brianna Stewart) | penalty =sentenced to three years in prison{{cite web|url=http://www.wweek.com/portland/article-3798-the_girl_from_electra.html |title=The Girl From Electra |publisher=Wweek.com |date=2004-11-10 |accessdate=2013-12-26}} | conviction_status = In June 2003, after serving two years and three months of her sentence, she was released from a [[Gig Harbor, Washington|Gig Harbour]], Washington, correctional institution | spouse = | children = | parents = | allegiance = | motive = | conviction = | reward_amount = | capture_status = | wanted_by = | partners = | wanted_since = | time_at_large = | escaped = | escape_end = | comments = | victims = | date = | time = | beginyear = | endyear = | country = | states = | locations = | targets = | fatalities = | injuries = | weapons = | apprehended = | imprisoned = | footnotes = }} '''Treva Joyce Throneberry''' (born May 18, 1969) is an American woman who spent most of her twenties pretending to be a teenager and engaging in other forms of con artistry, for which she would eventually be convicted and imprisoned. She made numerous false claims of [[sexual abuse]], including that she was a victim of [[satanic ritual abuse]] to gain money.{{cite web|url=http://www.chron.com/news/houston-texas/article/Woman-portrayed-self-as-abused-teen-since-1985-2061992.php |title=Woman portrayed self as abused teen since 1985 – Houston Chronicle |website=Chron.com |first=Bernadette|last=Pruitt|date=2001-11-11 |accessdate=2013-12-26}} During this time she traveled the United States, residing in foster homes, colleges and with any family that would take her in,{{cite web|url=http://www.portlandmercury.com/portland/treva-or-brianna/Content?oid=24561 |title=Treva or Brianna |work=Portland Mercury |first=Katia| last=Dunn|date= 2001-05-17|accessdate=2013-12-26}} using false identities. Her father, Carl Throneberry, said: "She's just going cross-country and using different names and receiving welfare." As of 2003, she falsely claimed to be a woman named Brianna Stewart who was born in 1981. Arrested in 2001 and charged with fraud and perjury, her true identity was established by DNA testing. Court-appointed psychologists deemed Throneberry to not be delusional, and that she knew what she was doing.{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2002/03/10/magazine/forever-young.html?pagewanted=all&src=pm | work=The New York Times | first=Emily | last=White | title=Forever Young | date=2002-03-10}} She was convicted and was given a three-year sentence at a correctional center in [[Gig Harbor, Washington]]. Throneberry was released after serving two years and three months of her sentence. == Early life and education == Treva Joyce Throneberry was born on May 18, 1969, in [[Wichita Falls, Texas|Wichita Falls]], [[Texas]], to Carl and Patsy Throneberry. Her father had dropped out of school in the sixth grade and, as an adult, "didn't know how to spell". Her family later moved to [[Electra, Texas|Electra]], Texas. She and her sisters were sexually abused by their uncle Billy Ray while growing up. Throneberry moved from Electra to Wichita Falls, Texas, in December 1985 when she was 15 years old, and enrolled in the local [[high school]].{{Citation needed|date=December 2013}} She began to tell stories about how she had been abducted and raped by [[Satanist]]s. In May 1986, Throneberry threatened to kill herself and was sent to a local [[mental hospital]], [[North Texas State Hospital#Wichita Falls Campus|Wichita Falls State Hospital]], for five months. While there, doctors said her condition was a [[Personality disorder|characterological disorder]] and she was given [[Perphenazine|Trilafon]], [[Imipramine|Tofranil]] and [[Alprazolam|Xanax]]. She refused to speak with her family when they visited. When she was discharged in October 1986, she was transferred to the Lena Pope Home for Troubled Girls, a [[residential treatment center]] in [[Fort Worth, Texas|Fort Worth]], Texas. While at Lena Pope, her therapist set a goal for her: to develop and [[Dialectical behavior therapy#Interpersonal effectiveness|maintain interpersonal relationships]]. She kept a distance from her family, only sending a letter now and then. Throneberry graduated from [[Arlington Heights High School]] in Fort Worth, Texas in 1987 and moved to [[Arlington, Texas|Arlington]], Texas. In Arlington, she rented her own apartment and worked as a hotel maid. == Crimes == For most of the 1990s, Throneberry wandered around the country using various names and identities. She said she was a teenager with an abusive background, lived in [[homeless shelter]]s and [[foster home]]s and enrolled in local high schools. She said that her Satanist father had raped her and killed her mother and also accused her foster parents, and other families that had taken her in, of sexual abuse for which police could not find any evidence. All cases were dismissed. In 1993, Throneberry was living in [[Corvallis, Oregon|Corvallis]], [[Oregon]], and passing herself off as a teenager named "Keili T. Throneberry Smitt" and "Keili Smitt". She was staying with a family she had met at a church. Throneberry went to court in [[Benton County, Oregon|Benton County]], Oregon, to legally change her name to Keili Smitt. Throneberry falsely reported to Corvallis police officers she had been raped by her father, who she at that point falsely claimed was a police officer, in Oregon. Thorneberry was charged with filing the false police report in Oregon. In 1996, Throneberry was in [[Altoona, Pennsylvania]].{{cite web|url=http://old.post-gazette.com/neigh_east/20011120eburbs1121p9.asp |title=East Briefs: 11/21/01 |publisher=Old.post-gazette.com |date=2001-11-21 |accessdate=2013-12-26}} She said that her name was "Stephanie Danielle Lewis" and that she was sixteen and was fleeing her Satanist parents with the help of the religious underground. After eighteen days of investigation, police contacted a girl she had known in Texas and found out who she really was. She was arrested, charged with giving false information and sentenced to nine days in jail. After her release she disappeared again and continued her wandering. In 1997, when she was acting as 17-year-old "Brianna Stewart" in [[Portland, Oregon|Portland]], Oregon, and [[Vancouver, Washington|Vancouver]], Washington, she falsely accused a 47-year-old security guard named Charles Blankenship of rape. She was actually 28 at the time. He was convicted in [[Clark County, Washington|Clark County]], Washington, of "having sex with a minor" and sentenced to 50 days in jail. After her fraud was exposed, a judge expunged Blankenship's conviction.{{cite web|url=http://old.post-gazette.com/regionstate/20010422impostor5.asp |title=Strange cases of 'teen' impostor |publisher=Old.post-gazette.com |date=2001-04-22 |accessdate=2013-12-26}}{{cite web|url=http://jclass.umd.edu/archive/newshoax/casestudies/idfraud/IDOtherWillaBrit1.html |title=The Hoax Project, Philip Merrill College of Journalism, University of Maryland, College Park |publisher=Jclass.umd.edu |date= |accessdate=2013-12-26}} Beginning in 1998, between the ages of 27 and 31, she spent five years in Vancouver, Washington, posing as an initially 16-year-old [[Evergreen High School (Vancouver, Washington)|Evergreen High School]] student named "Brianna Stewart", living in various strangers' homes. She had a 2.83 grade-point average and got a D grade in drama class.{{cite web|url=http://www.deseretnews.com/article/875635/Woman-convicted-of-posing-as-teen.html |title=Woman convicted of posing as teen |work=Deseret News |date=2001-11-21 |accessdate=2013-12-26}} She had a boyfriend for a year and a half, Kenny Dunn, and told him about her alleged abuse. First she claimed that she originated from [[Mobile, Alabama]]. Sympathetic benefactors gave her money and shelter but she eventually betrayed their trust by making false claims of abuse. In hindsight, many of the foster homes said they began to suspect that she was not a teenager. One dentist noticed that Stewart no longer had [[wisdom teeth]] and that the scars from their extraction were healed, unusual in a teenager. Throneberry, as "Brianna Stewart" graduated from Evergreen High School with the class of 2000 and enrolled at [[Clark College (Washington)|Clark College]]. In 2016, Throneberry resurfaced under the alias "Brianna Kenzie", accusing a local man of sexually assaulting her while she worked as a hotel employee. She was later fired after hotel employees learned of her prior record.{{Cite web|url=http://www.theolympian.com/news/local/crime/article86659452.html|title=Suspect in hotel assault cleared of charges|first=Andy|last=Hobbs|work=The Olympian|date= 2016-06-29|access-date=2016-06-30}} == Pop Culture == Her story inspired episode 21 of season 8 ("Pretend") of [[Law & Order: SVU]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0966157/trivia?ref_=tt_trv_trv|title=Law & Order: Special Victims Unit (TV Series) - Pretend - (2007) -Trivia|work=IMDb|access-date=2018-11-27}} == See also == *[[False accusation of rape]] *[[False allegation of child sexual abuse]] == References == {{reflist}} * [https://web.archive.org/web/20051125050220/http://www.crimelibrary.com/criminal_mind/scams/treva_throneberry/index.html Crime Library article about Treva Throneberry] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Throneberry, Treva}} [[Category:1969 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:20th-century American criminals]] [[Category:21st-century American criminals]] [[Category:Criminals from Texas]] [[Category:False allegations of sex crimes]] [[Category:Impostors]] [[Category:People from Fort Worth, Texas]] [[Category:People from Wichita Falls, Texas]] [[Category:People from Electra, Texas]]

'''Waga Hip Hop''' is one of the major international hip hop festivals taking place in West Africa. Each year, around early and mid-October, [[Ouagadougou]] ([[Burkina Faso]]) thus welcomes international artists and media to attend this festival of urban cultures.
== Waga Hip Hop and its framing == Created in 2000, Waga Hip Hop is the flagship event of the association Umane Culture.<ref>{{cite book |last=Janin| first=Sylviane |title=Burkina Faso |publisher=Editions Olizane |year=2010 |pages=197 |isbn= 2-88086-386-4}}</ref> This association stands out as an active cultural structure, which develops multidisciplinary projects, in music, theatre, dance and tales, created in 1997 by Ali Diallo (member of the Export Bureau of African Music, BEMA). The latest realisation of Umane Culture was the creation, in November 2008, of the first Burkinabé music market, Saga Musik.
At first, Waga Hip Hop was organised with local hip hop artists solely at a time when [[Hip Hop]] was booming in Burkina Faso (2001–2003) mainly thanks to the arrival of an initial studio (Abazon) whose arranger was specialised in hip hop productions ([[Smockey]]). However, very quickly, Waga Hip Hop reached an international scale, notably in 2002, with the support of international cultural organisations. Since then, and for each of its editions, Waga Hip Hop has welcomed artists coming from throughout the continent. With respect, it stands as one of the most visible festivals dedicated to the urban cultures in the West African region.<ref>{{cite journal |journal=Afrique Magazine |publisher= Groupe Jeune Afrique |volume= 269-274 |issue= 2008}}</ref> Unsurprisingly, Waga Hip Hop, as a yearly event, has now raised international consideration.<ref>{{cite journal |last= Chabasseur |first= Eglantine |title=Festival Ouga Hip Hop 2006: 6ème Edition |date=October 31, 2006 |journal= Radio France Internationale |url= http://www.rfimusique.com/musiquefr/articles/082/article_txt_16642.asp}}</ref>
== Waga Hip Hop and its diverse programming == Each year, Waga Hip Hop aims at being as largely as possible representative of all the urban cultures. As such, Waga Hip Hop not only welcomes in its organisation showcases and performances of hip hop artists but also those of other urban artists such as the now well-known Victor Démé who was discovered through a performance he gave during the festival. Besides, Waga Hip Hop regularly holds artistic residencies dedicated to the various disciplines of urban cultures such as hip hop dance, [[beatbox]] and other vocal urban music.<ref>{{cite journal |last1=Chabasseur |first1=Eglantine |date= October 19, 2009 |title= Waga Hip Hop 2009: Le festival qui ne dort jamais |journal= RFI |url=http://www.rfimusique.com/musiquefr/articles/118/article_17791.asp}}</ref> Its most famous production is “Waka Tibio”, which came out of the artistic residencies held during the 2008 and 2009 editions, and welcomed the joint performances of Fredy Massamba (DRC), [[King Ayisoba]] (Ghana), Awa Sissao (Burkina Faso) and DJ Gee Bayss (Senegal).
Besides, with the desire to expand its contribution to the whole country, Waga Hip Hop holds events in the capital city, i.e. Ouagadougou as well as throughout the country, in the different regional cities (Ouahigouya, [[Fada N’Gourma]], [[Bobo Dioulasso]], [[Pô]], [[Koudougou]]). Not only a space of creation and diffusion, Waga Hip Hop also stands as an important sphere of training and formation. Indeed, and in order to support the development of the local cultural community, the festival yearly organises workshops dedicated to the local cultural operators as well as to the artists.<ref>{{cite journal |last1=Chabasseur |first1=Eglantine |date= October 19, 2009 |title= Waga Hip Hop 2009: Le festival qui ne dort jamais |journal= RFI |url=http://www.rfimusique.com/musiquefr/articles/118/article_17791.asp}}</ref>
The principal partners of Waga Hip Hop are the Francophonia International Organisation (OIF), Africalia (Belgium), Culture France but also Staycalm!, a Paris-based artistic collective which has been supporting Waga Hip Hop since its early years. Staycalm! has now become well known for its multimedia production on West African Hip Hop, “Fangafrika”.
